metadata.intent: Establish master definition for character 'THAT IS TENNESSEE'
metadata.rationale: Extracted from canonical script and scene co-occurrence data.

data.description: Tennessee is a lanky I.T. worker at the office, introduced briefly during Greta's tour. He appears socially anxious and reclusive, barely acknowledging the new employee Dante before quickly looking away. He and his colleague John are described as looking like they haven't seen the light of day for years, suggesting they are deeply immersed in their technical work environment.
data.dialogue_summary: Tennessee has no spoken dialogue in the script. He is introduced by Greta during the office tour and reacts to Dante's arrival only with a quick, skittish glance before returning to his typing.

explicit_evidence.quote: Tennessee looks up from one of the desks quickly and skittishly looks away while typing.
explicit_evidence.source_scene: INT. CORRIDOR IN FRONT OF I.T. DESKS - MORNING

explicit_evidence.quote: Dante nods in hello at what appears to be the stocky guy (JOHN) and the lanky guy (TENNESSEE).
explicit_evidence.source_scene: INT. CORRIDOR IN FRONT OF I.T. DESKS - MORNING

explicit_evidence.quote: Our I.T. gentleman are here from dusk 'til dawn.
explicit_evidence.source_scene: INT. CORRIDOR IN FRONT OF I.T. DESKS - MORNING

inferred_traits.rationale: Tennessee quickly looks away after making eye contact and continues typing, in stark contrast to John who lingers and winks, suggesting a deeply introverted or socially anxious personality.
He is described as working from dusk till dawn and immediately returns to typing after the brief glance, indicating he is highly absorbed in his technical work.
The word 'skittishly' used to describe his reaction to being introduced implies discomfort with social interaction or new people.

data.name: THAT IS TENNESSEE

relationships.evidence: Tennessee and John share the I.T. desks and are introduced together as the office's I.T. team.
Greta introduces Tennessee to Dante as one of her hardest workers, indicating a supervisory relationship.
Tennessee is introduced to Dante during the office tour but does not engage with her beyond a skittish glance.

scene_presence: INT. CORRIDOR IN FRONT OF I.T. DESKS - MORNING
